Projects

I am currently working on the evolution of insecticide resistance adaptations in Anopheles mosquitoes responsible for malaria transmission as part of the Anopheles gambiae 1000 genomes.

The recurrent evolution of new resistance mechanisms in insect vectors is a major obstacle in our current efforts to curb and eradicate infectious diseases like malaria. In particular, I am involved in the analysis of data from the Anopheles gambiae 1000 genomes, as well as studying the role of alternative splicing and transcriptome variation in insecticide resistance. Alternative splicing of transcripts is a fast-evolving layer of transcriptomic regulation that bears enormous potential to understand the rapid emergence of resistance mechanisms in natural mosquito populations.

Xavier Grau-Bové | Millenial by Paul Le
